summary: This bill, the United States Foundation for International Food Security Act of 2025, establishes a private, nonprofit foundation to leverage private sector investments in international food security. It aims to improve agricultural production, build resilient food systems, reduce malnutrition, and drive economic growth in foreign countries. The bill outlines the Foundation's governance, powers, and obligations, including outcome-based funding, accountability measures, and prohibitions on supporting countries that support terrorism or violate human rights. The bill authorizes appropriations and mandates annual reporting to Congress.
